0Verb: using any method; (as standalone verb) replying "whatever" or "whichever"
0Note: Expresses 'any of X'. Can be used either as a modifier in noun and verb phrases, or as part of a compound words for other parts of speech.
Descriptive native name of this language (but it is not exclusive for this language as a term).

0Conjunction: less or equal; worse or the same; fewer or equal to
less than; worse than; fewer than

0Note: Used as a noun only when you answer kiw- (or wh-) questions.
As "language", it may or may not be verbal.
year (used only as a unit of time and not for expressing which year it is or something was)

0Noun: of this; 'that thing you are referring to'
0Note: Used to refer back to previous object of topic. In many cases interchangeable with 'li'. Only one of these can be used in each sentence!
Used similarily to English 'one' after adjectives. Also used when there would not be any nouns in the sentence (e.g. 'li nay' -- no; 'li lo' -- yes)
year after common era (I don’t have a definition when that would begin either)

0Verb: only; nothing else but; (as standalone verb) replying 'yes'
0Modifier: only; nothing else but; one (general number)
0Note: Expresses 'only X', implying that no one/nothing else is true besides X. Can be used either as a modifier in noun and verb phrases, or as part of a compound words for other parts of speech.

0Preposition: in; within; at the time of

0Note: year before common era
Expresses 'the opposite of X'. Can be used either as a modifier in noun and verb phrases, or as part of a compound words for other parts of speech.

0Noun: country; land belonging to or claimed by a group of people

0Note: year in common era

0Modifier: many; relatively large number; a lot; very (unreasonably so)
0Note: Similar to 'ki', but expresses relatively or unreasonably large amounts or numbers.

Expresses 'not X'. As a number, it can be used for the digit zero, or can be used in a compound modifier's end to express negatives. Can be used either as a modifier in noun and verb phrases, or as part of a compound words for other parts of speech.
It is the 'opposite' of 'ta'; 'ta' means a piece of fraction of a unit, while 'noy' is the whole, unbroken piece or unit
Transliteration of the non-native name of this language (Picilang).

0Preposition: besides; on the side of; in close proximity to

0Modifier: according to the system; systematic; systematically

0Verb: every possible way; (as standalone verb) replying "maybe"
0Note: Expresses 'every one of X'. Can be used either as a modifier in noun and verb phrases, or as part of a compound words for other parts of speech.

0Note: The 0.1 meaning is effectively the same as 'numbers behind the decimal point'.
Introduces a consequence or rationale. It is also used for asking "why", when used as a preposition followed by "kiwno".
